content:
" For a procedure not done (Procedure.notDone = true) there would not be a date or period when the procedure was performed.:
Options:

  • This constraint should only apply if notDone = false.
  • Would it be more useful for this to be the datetime when the proc was marked as not done?

I would expect the date to still be present as there'd be a need to assert when the "no procedure done" was asserted. If you want to say "I opted to not do the procedure today", you still need to capture the "when"
I agree and would like to see if EHR vendors do it this way too.
